Posts.Content: Hi Guys-- Doing research for my dad on his prostate cancer diagnosis about 1 hear and half ago. High PSA between 7.8 and high as 13 or so. Biopsy showed Gleason 3+3=6 Right Base PTI=5% Adenocarcinoma in specimen 9. Highest gleason is 6 involving 1 of 2 cores 5% pernieural invasion not present. Lesion about 4cm. 72 year old male. Seeing if treatment is rec. or Active surv. and thoughts on the two treatment options in New England area above. RI resident. I have heard potential issues with Very large size prostate about 3 times the size of the normal prostate. second biopsy year and half later shows Right base at 3+3=6 PTI now 10 percent NOW this new info below: Right Lateral Base 3+3=6 PTI 10 percent right lateral mid 3+3=6 PTI 2 PERCENT Adenocarcinoma in specimens 9,13,14. Highest gleason still remaining a 6 and highest PTI is still 10 Second biopsy year and half year later showing two more quartels of the prostate testing positive Have potential issues with Proton as it goes in and out of rectum and machines gen a lot of neutrons and could be carcinogenic? Anyone with experience with either treatments? or recommendations ?
Posts.Title: Pencil Proton Beam Therapy vs. Rapid Arc Therapy or VMAT

Posts.Content: Thank you for the info here…Cost is not so much a factor, just the best option of treatment…always wonder if surgery could even be the best option?
Posts.Title: Pencil Proton Beam Therapy vs. Rapid Arc Therapy or VMAT

Posts.Content: Thank you and best to you !
Posts.Title: Pencil Proton Beam Therapy vs. Rapid Arc Therapy or VMAT
Pencil Proton Beam Therapy vs. Rapid Arc Therapy or VMAT

Posts.Content: Your great!!! Thank you so much for the info here. For some reason, he does not have a terrible time urinating. There are so many options out there and I am so torn on which way to direct him in. I know he really would like to just do nothing, but feel as he is in a position to cure it now and hopefully be done.
